result.execSummary:
The defendant Roland D King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).
  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Settlement Form (PTC)

11:07 a.m.  State by ADA Lisa Vanden Branden.  Defendant present with Attorney Jon Wilsnack.

Statement by Attorney Wilsnack - prepared to proceed with plea/sentencing on 2014CF4 - requests preliminary hearing be set on 2013CF45.  Court states a preliminary hearing was held.

Court directs 2013CF45 be set for Status Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days.

2014CF4
Attorney Wilsnack waives the preliminary hearing on behalf of the defendant - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - waived by the defendant - Court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

ADA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Wilsnack.  Attorney Wilsnack confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - will enter a plea in accordance with the plea questionnaire.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.

ADA recites agreement - defendant plea to counts 1 through 8 and as repeaters - DRI balance of the counts (9 through 12).  Attorney Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - waived.  Court goes over the elements of each offense and as a repeater.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Court instructs regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to counts 1 through 8.  Court finds the pleas are made freely, voluntarily, intelligently, and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support each plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 1 through 8 as charged.  Court DRI counts 9, 10, 11, and 12.  Court orders a judgment of conviction be entered today.  ADA confirms compliance with any victim/witness rights.  Sentencing argument by ADA.  Sentencing argument by Attorney Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Count 1
Defendant sentenced to 3 1/2 years WSP - 18 months of IC and 24 months of ES - stayed and placed on probation for 10 years.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Pay court costs.
Abide with all rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay current child support as it is due.
Pay on arrears.
Within 60 days defendant and probation officer to come up with the arrearage amount and set a realistic payment plan.

Counts 2 through 8 - each count
Court orders SWD and defendant placed on probation for 10 years - concurrent to each other.
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
Pay court costs.
Abide with all rules/recommendations as imposed by the supervising agent.
Pay current child support as it is due plus arrears.
Within 60 days defendant and his probation officer to come up with a payment plan.

Court waives the payment of court costs on all 8 counts.  Court finds defendant doesn't have the ability to pay court costs.

Court finds the defendant eligible for ERP and CIP.

Court adjourned at 11:26 a.m.
from Atty Jon Wilsnack requesting the Waiver of Prelim scheduled on 07/22/2014 at 11:30 a.m. be removed from the court calendar and a plea & sentencing be scheduled.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 5, 2014 at 11:00 am.

Court adjourned at 1:59 p.m.
Status hearing on June 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties and as a repeater.  Court finds probable cause.
